question: What is the primary indication of tocilizumab?
ideal_answer: Tocilizumab is considered first-line treatment for rheumatoid arthritis.

snippets.text: For the first-line bDMARD/tsDMARD, either tumor necrosis factor inhibitors (TNFi), non-TNFi (abatacept, tocilizumab, rituximab), or tsDMARDs, may be considered.
Approximately 30% of patients with rheumatoid arthritis (RA) respond inadequately to conventional-synthetic disease-modifying anti-rheumatic drugs (csDMARDs).
